attributes.action: Keep David Cameron As Prime Minister, Guide the United Kingdom Through Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
David Cameron should stay as prime minister and guide the uk throughout Brexit. He has a lot of supporters in the in and out campaign.
I feel the out come is fair the people have voted.
Losing David Cameron would be a great loss, He lost the referendum now is not the time to quit
What the UK becomes next is scary & exciting at the same time and he should lead the country. This could make him one of the greatest prime ministers in history if the uk becomes a success outside of the eu.
Vote stay.
attributes.background:
I'm 33 from Bristol I didn't place a vote in the referendum due to not having an in or out opinion. 
I was stay in for many reasons safety of the eu, not wanting the country to collapse outside of of the eu
I was out for many reasons immigration, benefits going abroad, nhs.
Regards 
S. Morgan

rejection.details: In any case, as you might already know, the Prime Minister of the UK is not chosen by the UK Government or Parliament.
